attack type: match on demographic quasi-identifiers to find specific individual's arrest or conviction offense, sentence
remedy: enforce $k$-anonymity for quasi-identifiers by binning demographics and suppressing county if needed

attack type: match on criminal justice quasi-identifiers to identify an individual
disclosure when: crime or arrest cycle characteristics are unique/rare AND (individual's demographics are rare in the population OR demographics in associated OBTS records are homogenous)
remedy: enforce $k$-anonymity for criminal justice quasi-identifiers and enforce $l$ diversity for demographics given a criminal justice "key"

attack type: match on demographic quasi-identifiers for specific group
disclosure when: sensitive criminal justice values are homogeneous for demographic quasi-identifiers
remedy: enforce $l$-diversity for sensitive values by suppressing county

attack type: match on partial quasi-identifiers and offense code for unknown individual
disclosure when: other quasi-identifiers are homogeneous for offense code
remedy: \color{red}{could enforce $l$-diversity for combinations of quasi-identifiers: 1) d-1 demographic vars AND arrest offense or 2) d-1 demographic vars and conviction offense ?}

attack type: match on demographic quasi-identifiers for specific group
disclosure when: sensitive values are near homogeneous for quasi-identifiers and all of a similar severity
